t: Sing,*p O barren, thou that didst not bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud, thou that didst not travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife, saith the Lord.*s
Enlarge*p the place of thy tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of thine habitations: spare not, lengthen thy cords, and strengthen thy stakes;
For*p thou shalt break forth on the right hand and on the left; and thy seed shall inherit the Gentiles, and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.

Fear*p not; for thou shalt not be ashamed: neither be thou confounded; for thou shalt not be put to shame: for thou shalt forget the shame of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood any more.
For*p thy Maker is thine husband; the Lord*s of hosts is his name; and thy Redeemer the Holy One of Israel; The God of the whole earth shall he be called.
For*p the Lord*s hath called thee as a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit, and a wife of youth, when thou wast refused, saith thy God.
For*p a small moment have I forsaken thee; but with great mercies will I gather thee.
In*p a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment; but with everlasting kindness will I have mercy on thee, saith the Lord*s thy Redeemer.
For*p this is as the waters of Noah unto me: for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah should no more go over the earth; so have I sworn that I would not be wroth with thee, nor rebuke thee.
For*p the mountains shall depart, and the hills be removed; but my kindness shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, saith the Lord*s that hath mercy on thee.
O*p thou afflicted, tossed with tempest, and not comforted, behold, I will lay thy stones with fair colours, and lay thy foundations with sapphires.
And*p I will make thy windows of agates, and thy gates of carbuncles, and all thy borders of pleasant stones.
And*p all thy children shall be taught of the Lord;*s and great shall be the peace of thy children.
In*p righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
Behold,*p they shall surely gather together, but not by me: whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake.
Behold,*p I have created the smith that bloweth the coals in the fire, and that bringeth forth an instrument for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy.

No*p weapon that is formed against thee shall prosper; and every tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord,*s and their righteousness is of me, saith the Lord.*s
